answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Alex,
These links should help you get started.
The Montgomery County public School website provides Workers' Compensation Leave procedures which includes the employee requirements during the leave period.  
http://www.montgomeryschoolsmd.org/departments/ersc/employees/leave/workerscomp/ 
The Montgomery County, MD workers compensation Audit report explains the overall compensation procedure and assesses the existing policies with recommendations. 
http://www.montgomerycountymd.gov/content/inspectorg/pdffiles/workerscomp.pdf
The Washington D.C. worker’s compensation website provides all the forms and an “Employee’s Rights and Obligations information sheet” which gives a general overview and layouts all necessary procedures and entitlements for the claimant.
http://does.dc.gov/does/cwp/view,a,1232,q,537428.asp 
And finally a document on the Knowledge Network, Collective Bargaining Agreement between the town of Mansfield, Connecticut and a Local Union addresses Workers Compensation and highlights the organization’s responsibilities during the employee’s leave period. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1256/Collective_Bargaining_Agreement 
I hope that is helpful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Alex Carmichael
text:
Hello all
I am a graduate intern in city government and I have been given the assignment of creating a worker’s comp brochure to give injured employees post incident. I’d like to benchmark other organization’s procedures regarding employee responsibilities and information while on leave. Can anyone point me towards such resources? Thank you for your help. 
Cordially,
Alex Carmichael
title: Post-Injury Worker’s Comp Procedures
